channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Record-Shattering $1 Trillion Poured Into ETFs This Year
item.description: Assets in U.S. exchange-traded funds grew by more than 30% in 2024.

item.title: Stock Futures Slip and Boeing Stock Drops After South Korean Crash
item.description: U.S. stock futures fell following declines in Asia and Europe. With the year wrapping up on Tuesday, many investors were likely trimming risk from the...

item.title: The ‘BATMMAAN’ stocks swooped to the market’s rescue in December. Will they keep climbing in 2025?
item.description: After a blistering 2024 rally, the U.S. stock market has run into a bit of trouble in December.

item.title: ‘He ended up homeless and penniless’: My uncle conned my father into signing over their mother’s house. What can I do?
item.description: “His brother went to the prison where my dad was incarcerated and had him sign over the house.”

item.title: Boeing shares fall in wake of deadliest air crash in South Korean history
item.description: Jeju Air’s flight 2216 crash landed at South Korea’s Muan International Airport on Dec. 29 killing 179 of the Boeing plane’s 181 passengers

item.title: Oil Prices Slip But Hold at Higher Levels After U.S. Inventories Report
item.description: Oil fell but remains up around 1.5% on week after a larger-than-expected drop in U.S. inventories fueled optimism in the market and strengthened price...

item.title: Gold Futures Fall as Market Awaits New Catalysts
item.description: Gold futures fell in thin holiday trading as the market awaits fresh catalysts in 2025, with the Fed’s approach to loosening monetary policy and Donal...

item.title: Rising Treasury yields are the biggest challenge to this bull market. Here are the ‘trigger levels’ to watch.
item.description: Expect more equity and bond market volatility in early 2025, says Evercore ISI

item.title: Drug Middlemen Spared by Trump and Musk, for Now
item.description: Pharmacy-benefit managers are facing intense pressure in Washington.

item.title: Mr. Chow founder cuts the price of his art-filled, museum-inspired L.A. mansion to $65 million
